key_points: Tiger Woods has returned home to South Florida after a 21-day hospital stay following a car accident.
The accident occurred on the border of Rancho Palos Verdes and Rolling Hills Estates, Calif.
Woods suffered comminuted fractures to the tibia and fibula bones, along with foot and ankle injuries.
After initial treatment at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center, he was moved to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center for successful follow-up procedures.
Woods thanked the medical personnel involved in his care in a statement.
Woods has not provided a public timeline for his recovery or information about his future in competitive golf.
The sports world, including PGA Tour pros, showed support for Woods by wearing his iconic 'Sunday Red'.
Woods' statement was released on his social media accounts.
He expressed gratitude for the support and encouragement received following the accident.
Woods is focused on recovering at home and getting stronger every day.
